page.title: 10OLD SCHOOL
page.content:
{OLD SCHOOL AT WINESTEAD}
When the school closed it was used as a Village Hall for activities such as a library and for whist drives and parties etc. and was still owned by the Local Authority. When it became no longer a viable proposition it was sold to the present owner in 1980. The new owner raised the roof by many courses to make it two floors high and removed many unsightly outbuildings. They also made the playground into a garden and added many more structural features and amenities. It now consists of a lounge, living room, dining area, kitchen and sun-lounge with breakfast area and a bathroom up and downstairs and four bedrooms. Formerly as a school it only had one large room with a partition and kitchen. The present value is Â£57,750
